metadata.title: CVE-2020-25641 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's implementation of biovecs inversions before 5.9-rc7. A zero-length biovec request issued by the blocksubsystem could cause the kernel to enter an infinite loop, causing adenial of service. This flaw allows a local attacker with basic privilegesto issue requests to a block device, resulting in a denial of service. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25641` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
